seite1.update3: Would you like to download the new version?
seite1.error4:
The Modinstaller cannot find the Minecraft location.
Please choose the Minecraft folder (.minecraft)!
seite1.inter4:
Unfortunately, the program was unable to connect to the Internet to download the mod list.
Either your PC is not connected to the Internet or
a firewall (including the operating system) is blocking the Internet access for Java.

Java reported...
seite1.lessmc:
We recommend the installation another Minecraft version (e.g. 1.7.10, 1.8) via the Minecraft Launcher.

Click in the MC Launcher bottom left on Edit Profile and choose at Use version e.g. release 1.7.10.
Confirm with Save Profile, click on Play and wait until Minecraft has started completely.
Exit Minecraft and start the Modinstaller again.
seite1.lessmc1: You have installed Minecraft versions for those we cannot offer any mods.
seite1.lessmc1h: No mods for your Minecraft version available
seite1.lessmc2: You have installed Minecraft versions for those we can offer only a few mods.
seite1.lessmc2h: Only a few mods are available
seite1.version:
We could not find a valid Minecraft installation in the Minecraft folder "versions".
Please install for example Minecraft 1.7.10 using the latest Minecraft Launcher version!
seite1.inco:
A current mod list could not be downloaded because 
we do not offer a mod list for your selected Minecraft version.
We only support release versions newer than Minecraft version 1.4.2.
Nevertheless you can import mods by using the Modinstaller, after you've downloaded them.
seite1.compt: Did the mods function properly you installed with the Modinstaller?

seite2.headline: Please select the mods you want to install...
seite2.wait:
One moment, please...

The Modinstaller is loading the mod descriptions and their ratings fitting to your selected Minecraft version.
seite2.importm:
Make sure the mod you import is a Modloader Mod. This mod is installed directly into the minecraft.jar. However, if the file has to be copied into the mods folder, please select the Forge list first (if Forge is available in your Minecraft Version).

Then drag the Mod file on the big picture or the right list. If a ZIP or JAR file has been selected, the file will be unpacked and all files are compressed into the minecraft.jar. You can also add folders. Then the contents of the folder (including subfolders) are packed into the minecraft.jar. Individual files (e.g. Java class files .class or images) can also be imported.
seite2.importf:
Make sure the mod you import is a Forge Mod. The imported file will be automatically installed into the "mods" folder in Minecraft folder (with the Minecraft Forge). If you would like to pack the file or the content of the archive (ZIP or JAR file) directly into the minecraft.jar, please select the Modloader list in the Modinstaller fist (e.g. for OptiFine).

Then drag the mod file into the right list or big picture. If a ZIP or JAR file has been selected, the file will be extracted and the archive content will be analysed. The Modinstaller automatically detects where your mod in the archive is and how it is installed. Then it will show you important information from mod developer in a tabular form. You'll be warned if your imported mod should not be compatible with your selected Minecraft version.
seite2.restore: <html><body>Minecraft was successfully restored at the time of the last installation!</body></html>

We will add the mod to the "mods" folder nevertheless.
